page.title: 16THE NEW SHOPPING CENTRE,INCE
page.content: {TRADE}- In December 1984 the new Smithy Green Shopping Centre opened. After years of neglect this represents a new lease of life for trade in the area especially when associated with the new housing development. {MATERIALS}- The Centre is made of distinctive red brick, the roof tiles are a black compound and the roof frames are made of wood. {FACILITIES}- When finally complete there will be a number a shops (some of which are already open), a library and a bank. {COMMENTS}- "I think the library will save a lot of travelling particularly for O.A.P's as the nearest one is two miles away." "The shops are clean and pleasant-smelling" "The take-away is a good idea; the chicken is nice and crispy and the people who go at night are mainly young".
